column4: is this after wiping out the partition table and starting anew or is this just a freeze/error in the installer?
it starts, but error stops the installer after 33%
probably an issue with the new installer on that hardware. look at the boot options on the installer setup.. i think its f5 or something like that.. try acpi=off
Hey now, i'm not that technical :D
well sometimes you gotta be :) linux isn't that polished yet, just give it a shot, when it says "press enter to boot" try this option: acpi=off
at the command line just try "acpi=off" without the quotes
hmm: "could not find kernel image: acpi=off"
actually try all this on one line mineaswell turn off all the buggy stuff: "noapic nolapic pci=noacpi"
ya it looks like you do need the "linux" preceding the parameters
try wiping out the entire partition table and starting from scratch.. i think the "automatic" option will do that.
with the partitioner do you choose the "automatic" option or do you do it manually
did you get your installation going?
no me and moquist is working on it in private
